All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AngleIndexes
Enumeration representing indexes for angles on a card.
Angles
Enumeration representing different types of angles on a card.
Board
Represents the game board where cards can be placed and manipulated.
Board.necessaryResourcesNotAvailableException
Exception indicating that the necessary resources for placing a card are not available.
Board.notAvailableCellException
Exception indicating that the cell is not available for placing a card.
BoardObserver
Observer responsible for handling updates related to the game board and notifying the server.
BroadcastMessage
BroadcastMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for broadcasting messages to all connected views.
BroadcastMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to broadcast a message to all players.
Card
Abstract class representing a card in the game.
CardDeserializer
Utility class for deserializing card objects from JSON files.
Cell
Represents a single cell on the game board.
CellState
Enumeration representing the states of a cell in a game scenario.
ChatErrorMessage
ChatErrorMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for signaling errors related to chat functionality.
ChooseGoalState
Represents the state where a player chooses their private goal in the game.
ChoosePrivateGoalMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to choose a private goal for a player.
ClientInterface
This interface defines the methods that a client can invoke remotely on a server.
ClientRMI
Represents a client using RMI (Remote Method Invocation) to communicate with a server.
CliViewClient
Represents a CLI-based view client that interacts with a game through a ClientInterface.
Color
Enumeration representing colors.
ConnectionState
Represents the initial state where a player can create a game, join an existing game, or rejoin a previous game.
CreateGameMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to create a new game instance.
DiagonalGoalCard
Represents a diagonal goal card in the game.
DrawFromPublicCardsMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to draw a card from the public cards.
DrawFromTheDeckMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to draw a card from a specified deck.
DrawState
Represents the state where a player can choose to draw a card from either the public cards or one of the decks.
EndGameState
Represents the state when the game ends, displaying final scores and winners.
Front
Abstract class representing the front side of a card in the game.
Game
class containing all the model objects necessary for the game.
GameController
Controller class of the game.
GameIsEndingMessage
GameIsEndingMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for notifying that the game is ending.
GameLauncher
Entry point for launching either the server or client for the Codex Naturalis game.
GameObserver
Observer responsible for handling game updates and notifying the server.
GameState
Enumeration representing the possible states of a game.
GoalCard
Abstract class representing a goal card in the game.
GoldCard
Represents a Gold Card in the game, which is a type of Resource Card.
GoldFront
Represents the front side of a gold card in the game.
GUIMain
This class represents the main application for the GUI.
JoinGameMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to join a game with a specified nickname.
LastPlayerStandingMessage
LastPlayerStandingMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for notifying that a single player remains as the last player standing in the game.
LocalBoard
Represents the local board containing cells, card lists, angles counters, and score.
LocalModel
Represents the local model that manages game state, player information, cards, boards, and communication in a multiplayer game environment.
MainView
The main entry point for the Codex Naturalis game application.
MainViewController
Main GUI controller.
ModelMessage
ModelMessage is an abstract class that serves as a base for various types of messages exchanged within the model of a software application.
NetworkManager
Manages network communication and synchronization between the game controller and views.
NumberOfMessages
NumberOfMessages class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for setting the number of messages and increasing the count of arrived messages in the local model of a specified view.
ObjectsGoalCard
Represents goal cards that involve counting pairs or triplets of specific objects (Angles) on the player's board.
ObServerManager
Manages incoming ModelMessages from various sources (RMI or SocketServer) and distributes them accordingly.
OwnWhisperMessage
OwnWhisperMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for indicating a whisper message sent by the local user.
PlayCardMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to play a card on the game board.
Player
Represents a player in the game.
PlayerObserver
Observer responsible for handling updates specific to a player and notifying the server.
PlayStarterCardMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to play a starter card.
PlayState
PlayState represents the state where a player can interactively play their turn in the game.
Pong
Represents a message used for pong responses in network communication.
QuitMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to handle a quit request from a client.
ReadyToStartState
ReadyToStartState represents the state where the game is ready to begin, waiting for players to choose their private goals.
ReJoinMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to rejoin a game with a specified nickname.
RejoinState
RejoinState represents the state where a player rejoins an ongoing game session.
RemovedPlayerMessage
 
ResourceCard
Represents a Resource Card in the game.
ResourceFront
Represents the front side of a resource card in the game.
ResourceGoalCard
Represents goal cards that involve counting triplets of a specific type of resource (Angles) on the player's board.
RMIServer
 
ScoreTypes
Enumeration representing different types of scoring mechanisms in the game.
ServerInterface
Remote interface for the server in a client-server architecture using RMI.
ServerMain
The main class to start the server application.
SetColorMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to set a player's color.
SetColorState
SetColorState represents the state where players choose their pawn color at the beginning of the game.
SocketClient
SocketClient class implements the ClientInterface for communication with a server over sockets.
SocketClientHandler
This class handles communication with a client connected via a socket.
SocketServer
This class represents a server that listens for incoming client connections via sockets and manages communication with connected clients.
StarterCard
Represents a Starter Card in the game.
StarterState
StarterState represents the state where players play their starter card at the beginning of the game.
StepGoalCard
Represents a step goal card in the game, which defines a specific pattern of resources on the board to achieve and score points.
SupportGoldCard
A support class for deserializing Gold Card data from JSON files.
SupportResourceCard
A support class for deserializing Resource Card data from JSON files.
SupportStarterCard
A support class for deserializing Starter Card data from JSON files.
UpdatedAckMessage
UpdatedAckMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for updating acknowledgement status in the context of a game.
UpdatedAvailableGoalsMessage
UpdatedAvailableGoalsMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for updating the list of available goal cards in a game.
UpdatedBoardMessage
UpdatedBoardMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for updating the board state in a game.
UpdatedColorMessage
UpdatedColorMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for updating the color of a player in a game.
UpdatedCurrentPlayerMessage
UpdatedCurrentPlayerMessage class represents a specific type of ModelMessage used for updating the current player in a game.
UpdatedErrorMessage
Represents an updated error message to be executed by the view.
UpdatedGameStateMessage
Represents an updated game state message to be executed by the view.
UpdatedGoldDeckMessage
Represents an updated message for the top gold card in the deck to be executed by the view.
UpdatedHandMessage
Represents an updated message for the player's hand to be executed by the view.
UpdatedIsOnlineMessage
Represents an updated message indicating the online status of a player to be executed by the view.
UpdatedNicknameMessage
Represents an updated message for a nickname change to be executed by the view.
UpdatedPlayerStateMessage
Represents an updated message for the player's state (game state) to be executed by the view.
UpdatedPublicCardsMessage
Represents an updated message for the public cards to be executed by the view.
UpdatedPublicGoalsMessage
Represents an updated message for the public goals to be executed by the view.
UpdatedResourceDeckMessage
Represents an updated message for the top resource card in the resource deck to be executed by the view.
UpdatedStarterCardMessage
UpdatedStarterCardMessage is a type of ModelMessage that represents an update to the starter card.
UpdatedWinnersMessage
Represents an updated message for announcing winners to be executed by the view.
View
Interface representing a generic view for the Codex Naturalis game.
ViewMessage
Interface for messages that can be executed by a GameController.
ViewState
ViewState is an abstract class representing a state in the user interface for a game client.
WaitingForTurnState
Represents the state where the client is waiting for their turn to play.
WaitingState
Represents a state where the client is waiting for model acknowledgement.
WhisperMessage
Represents a whisper message to be executed by the view.
WhisperMessage
Represents a message that instructs the GameController to send a whisper message to a player.
WinnerDueToForfeitMessage
